III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention: (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to: (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A reported that while placed at Christ Child House around
November 2024, two staff members pushed his head on the metal
bed frame. Youth A reports he was injured but did not receive
medical attention.
Investigation Interviews:
On 06/13/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Youth
A at Wedgewood by DHHS Specialist 1. I participated via
telephone. Youth a reported that on November 27, 2024, Staff 1
and Staff 2 pushed his head into the metal bed frame. He could
not recall if this had been investigated before or if he had spoken
about it previously. Youth A stated that he was injured, but could
not state how he was hurt, where his injuries were and if he was
seen for any medical attention. Youth A denied that he was being
restrained during this incident and reported that he left Christ Child
House after.
On 06/17/2025 an email correspondence was sent to
Complainant to inquire about any additional concerns. No
additional concerns were noted.
On 06/17/2025 an email correspondence was sent to Foster Care
Worker (FCW) advising of investigation and inquiring about any
concerns with the agency while youth was placed there. FCW
responded and indicated no concerns.
On 06/17/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Chief
Administrator (CA) at Christ Child House (CCH). She was
advised of the allegations of the special investigation. She denied
recalling an incident involving Youth A reporting having his head
hit on a bed frame.
On 06/23/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 2 at
Christ Child House with DHHS Specialist 2. Staff 2 recalled an
incident involving Youth A being escalated and requiring staff
intervention. He was unable to recall the date. Staff 2 recalled
2

that Youth A had hit Staff 3 and Staff 1 was attempting to redirect
him. Staff 2 recalled that this occurred in the bedroom of the
youth. Staff 2 reported that Youth A was escalated and was also
making attempts/threats to go out his window, but staff continued
to redirect him. Staff 2 denied that Youth A hit his head on the
bed and denied that he or Staff 1 pushed the youth. He also
denied that they hit the head of Youth A on the bed frame. Staff 2
denied hitting any youth at the agency. He reported that no youth
were in the hallway during the incident. Staff 2 could not recall if
the police were called or arrived that day.
On 06/23/2025 an in-person interview was held with Staff 3 at
CCH and DHHS Specialist 2 was also present. Staff 3 denied any
concerns with Staff 1 or Staff 2. She denied observing either
employee being inappropriate with youth at CCH, specifically
Youth A. Staff 3 reported that she did recall Youth A and recalled
him often being escalated at the agency. Staff 3 recalled an
incident where Youth A was throwing objects at her and hit her a
few times. She recalled Staff 1 and Staff 2 were in the room of
Youth A trying to deescalate him. She denied observing Youth A
being pushed down and hitting his head on the bed frame. She
recalled that Youth A was lifting his bead up and down from the
floor and hit his foot with the bed leg but was not injured. Staff 3
also stated that Youth A may have fallen and bumped his head,
but did not have any marks or bruises. She did not recall seeing
Staff 1 or Staff 2 place their hands on Youth A and could not recall
the date or timeframe of the event. Staff 3 believed that the
police were called but was not sure.
On 06/23/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 4
at CCH. DHHS Specialist 2 was also present. He denied having
any concerns with Staff 1 or Staff 2 and their interaction with youth
at the agency. Staff 4 was familiar with Youth A, but denied
recalling any incidents involving Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2.
On 06/23/2025 an in-person interview was completed with Staff 5.
DHHS Specialist 2 was also present. Staff 5 reported that she
recalled Youth A and an incident that occurred when she was in
training. She stated that she started working at Christ Child House
at the end of February 2025. She recalled she was sitting at the
end of the hallway and could see objects being thrown out of
Youth A’s bedroom toward Staff 3. She denied being able to see
into the room of Youth A and had no knowledge of anything that
occurred in the room.
3

On 06/26/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Staff 1 at
CCH. DHHS Specialist 2 was also present. Staff 1 advised she
recalled Youth A. Staff 1 denied seeing staff hit Youth A’s head
on the bedframe. She reported that she vaguely recalls Youth A
stating he was going to go out the window in his room and that he
was throwing objects at staff members. Staff 1 stated she was
attempting to verbally redirect him, but was not successful. She
stated Youth A was in his room, but she denied she or any other
staff ever hit Youth A or any other youth in the agency. Staff 1
denied that Youth A was injured and could not recall if the police
were called.
On 06/26/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Youth B and
Youth C at CCH. Both youth reported recalling Youth A but
denied seeing staff being physically inappropriate with him. Youth
B and Youth C also denied that Staff 1, Staff 2 or any other staff
are physically aggressive with youth and they denied knowledge
of staff hitting the head of Youth A on the agency bed rail.
On 06/26/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Director of
Residential (DR) at CCH. DHHS Specialist 2 was also present.
It was confirmed that Youth A was placed at CCH from
11/26/2024 and his last day was 03/05/2025. She further advised
that Youth A did not have a documented incident report (IR) for
November 2024 involving Staff 1, Staff 2 or Staff 3. She did
confirm there were four incident reports completed involving Youth
A and the identified staff.
Video Footage Review:
Due to the timeframe between the alleged incident and DCWL
investigation, there was no video footage available.
Documents Reviewed:
Christ Child House Discipline & Behavior Management Policy –
Prohibited Procedures: To ensure that residents rights are
protected, and that service is provided in a manner consistent with
best practice standards outlined below, behavior support
guidelines established by Christ Child House specifically prohibit
the use of restrictive or otherwise unacceptable actions by staff
members included, but not limited to the following criteria
examples:
-Corporal punishment of residence by staff
-Fear eliciting/aversive or any other restrictive/intrusive
consequences
-Physical abuse or verbal abuse of residents by staff
4

Christ Child House Incident Reports –
Incident Report #1 Dated 12/30/2024 Referenced Youth A going
AWOL from CCH. Incident Report written by Staff 1
Incident Report #2 Dated 03/05/2025 Referenced destructive
behavior of Youth A in his room. Youth A threatened to go AWOL
and jump out his window. Youth A was hitting staff with items and
was escalated in his room. Law enforcement was contacted.
Incident Report written by Staff 3.
Incident Report #3 Dated 03/05/2025 Documented the defiant
behavior of Youth A. He was running and screaming in the
hallway and tripped on the garbage can. Incident Report written
by Staff 6.
Incident Report #4 Dated 03/05/2025 Documented defiant
behavior, aggressive behavior, property destruction and
instigating behavior of Youth A. He was upset after hitting his foot
in his room. Youth A was threatening staff, throwing objects,
using profanity, hitting staff and was dysregulated. Staff
attempting to redirect. Law Enforcement contacted for assistance.
Incident Report written by Staff 2.
Christ Child House Employee Discipline-
Staff 1 received a verbal warning on 6/5/25 for violation of CCH
policies and procedures and breach of program guidelines.
Staff 2 received a verbal warning on 4/16/25 for violation of CCH
Safe Driving Policy, final written warning on 2/5/25 for attendance,
second written warning on 11/4/24 for attendance, verbal warning
on 10/23/2024 for attendance and three-day suspension and last
chance agreement on 05/22/2025 for non-adherence to CCH
policies, practice, procedures and rules.
Tour of Agency:
A tour of the agency and bedroom area was completed on
06/23/2025. No areas of concern were noted.
Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Both staff and youth were
interviewed and there was no evidence to support allegations of
non-compliance by the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
